revised_title: Maurice Neville Hill: A Life in Science and Service
tldr: Maurice Neville Hill was a talented scientist and sailor, born into a family of notable figures. He developed a love for the sea and oceanography from a young age, which led him to work in various scientific fields, including naval science and geophysics. During World War II, he contributed to the development of countermeasures against German acoustic homing torpedoes and made seismic observations in the deep sea to determine the thickness of sediments and the nature of rocks beneath.
